sentences.en: A staid - looking gentleman was upset at the dress of some young people in the street.
sentences.cn: 一位样子 古板 的绅士,对大街上一些年轻人的穿着很反感.

sentences.en: Chrysler products were perceived as staid and a little boring.
sentences.cn: 克莱斯勒公司的车子被人认为式样太死板,令人有点生厌.

sentences.en: Competition is forcing once - staid publications to spice up their content.
sentences.cn: 竞争迫使一度严肃的报刊增加“猛料”提高内容的趣味性.

sentences.en: Dark blue is sometimes seen as staid or stodgy - old - fashioned.
sentences.cn: 深蓝色的是有时被视为稳重或油腻 - 老式.

sentences.en: For a young Moroccan couple, getting married is no staid affair.
sentences.cn: 对年轻的摩洛哥情侣而言, 结婚并不会是件乏味的事.

sentences.en: He does this by transmitting not a staid image but a simulacra.
sentences.cn: 他不是通过传输固定的图像而是传输某种拟像而做到了这一点.

sentences.en: He had grown staid and dull.
Her thoughts were staid and solemnly adapted to a condition.
sentences.cn: 她的思想已经定形,安于一板一眼地顺应现实.

sentences.en: However, it is as likely that they will carry on with their staid, conservative strategies.
sentences.cn: 不过, 它们同样可能会继续执行沉着 、 保守的策略.

sentences.en: I always thought of him as a rather staid old gentleman.
sentences.cn: 我一直以为他是个相当古板的绅士.

sentences.en: Staid men and good scholars at first expressed mirth.
sentences.cn: 持重的人和渊博的学者起初看了觉得好笑.

sentences.en: The earth by the sky staid with, the daily close of their junction.
sentences.cn: 大地紧倚著天空, 它们每天都连接起来.

sentences.en: The locals were a very staid lot.
They showed a staid mood in that accident.
sentences.cn: 那次事件中他们的情绪很稳定.

sentences.en: We think of the Puritans as staid people.
sentences.cn: 我们认为清教徒是很稳重的人.
